head.title: Black, White, Gray: America Talks About Race

hedline.hl1: Black, White, Gray: America Talks About Race

abstract.p: Sean Gallagher letter says New York Times series on race in America is eye-opening

block.p: Your series ''How Race Is Lived in America'' has been eye-opening and disturbing. Eye-opening because I was unaware how much organized and casual racism still exists throughout American culture.
Disturbing because those profiled in the various articles, whatever race they were, seemed to say: The racial divide in our country is still wide, and there's nothing that can be done about it.
Your series ''How Race Is Lived in America'' has been eye-opening and disturbing. Eye-opening because I was unaware how much organized and casual racism still exists throughout American culture.
Disturbing because those profiled in the various articles, whatever race they were, seemed to say: The racial divide in our country is still wide, and there's nothing that can be done about it.
This is as intolerable as racism itself. I realize this is not a struggle that can be won overnight, but it is a struggle that should be fought.
